text: You see, for some of you, all of the steps and the skills that go into care tasks run on autopilot. But for millions of people, the autopilot is broken.

text: And what's worse, what if you had to do all of that when your mom just died?

text: Or you're using every ounce of strength that you have to just not kill yourself today?

text: If you have access to therapy, it's unlikely your therapist will ever ask you about your laundry.
summary: if you have access to therapy, it's unlikely your therapist will ever ask you about your laundry.

text: I've worked in mental health for about a decade. I've been in therapy even longer.
summary: i've worked in mental health for about a decade . I've been in therapy even longer .

text: And the only time I ever had a provider talk to me about things like cooking and cleaning and brushing my teeth  was when I was in a psych hospital as a teenager.
summary: the only time I ever had a provider talk to me about things like cooking and cleaning and brushing my teeth was when I was in a psych hospital .

text: Yet here were hundreds of thousands of people in my comment sections telling me  that these daily care tasks were a major pain point in their life.
summary: hundreds of thousands of people in my comment sections told me that these daily care tasks were a major pain point in their life .

text: And so I started to wonder, what if we started here?
summary: so I started to wonder, what if we started here? i started to ask, what would we start here?

text: What if we started with these care tasks?
summary: what if we started with these care tasks? care tasks are a big part of the care process .

text: Could making daily tasks easier improve mental health quicker?
summary: could making daily tasks easier improve mental health quicker? can daily tasks be easier to manage and improve your mental health?

text: In the two years that I've been posting and writing about the intersection of mental health and care tasks,  I've come up with a philosophy that does just this.
summary: in the two years that I've been posting and writing about the intersection of mental health and care tasks, i've come up with a philosophy that does just this .

text: And it all starts with one simple idea.
summary: it all starts with one simple idea . and it starts with a simple idea of what to do with it.

text: Cooking, cleaning, laundry, it doesn't make you a good person or a bad person.
summary: cooking, cleaning, laundry, it doesn't make you a good person or a bad person .

text: Listen to me.
summary: listen to me . listen to my . . Listen to me, listen to you .

text: Care tasks are morally neutral.
summary: care tasks are morally neutral and morally neo-existent . care tasks have a moral and moral balance .

text: Now I know that if you've been watching Martha Stewart for decades  and scrolling the perfect Pinterest aesthetic every day,  that it can feel like struggling with these tasks is a moral failure.
summary: if you've been watching Martha Stewart for decades, that it can feel like struggling with these tasks is a moral failure .

text: Like it's because we're lazy or we're irresponsible or we're immature.
summary: like it's because we're lazy, or we are irresponsible or immature .

text: But having an organized closet doesn't make you a success.
summary: having an organized closet doesn't make you a success . but having a closet isn't a good idea .

text: And living out of a pile of laundry on the floor doesn't make you a failure.
summary: living out of a pile of laundry on the floor doesn't make you a failure .

summary: you know where the shirt you want to wear is . the shirt is a t-shirt that you want a shirt to wear.

summary: it might take you a bit of sifting to find it . it just, it may take you some swiping .

summary: the truth is it's not about morality . the truth: morality is not morality, morality and morality.

summary: it's about functionality . a few of the features are available in the u.s.

text: Does your home work for you?
summary: does your home work for you? Does your home works for you . is your home a good idea?

text: Not some hypothetical house guest that is coming to inspect your closet.
summary: not some hypothetical house guest that is coming to inspect your closet . if you are a house guest, be sure to check out your closet for a few weeks .

text: I mentioned Amanda who had lost her baby and forgot how to wash dishes.
summary: Amanda had lost her baby and forgot how to wash dishes . she forgot to wash her dishes and said she had lost the baby .

text: She told me that when her husband would go to work, she would lay on the floor next to the empty crib  and say to herself, what can I bring to my family if I can't even wash dishes?
summary: when her husband would go to work, she would lay on the floor next to the empty crib and say to herself, what can i bring to my family if I can't wash dishes?

text: But that changed when she began to see care tasks as morally neutral.
summary: care tasks changed when she began to see care tasks as morally neutral . but that changed after she began seeing care tasks .

text: All of a sudden the dishes in the sink weren't representations of her failure as a wife,  but instead she would look at the pile and think to herself,  what do I need to function tomorrow morning?
summary: the dishes in the sink weren't representations of her failure as a wife . she would look at the pile and think to herself, what do I need to function tomorrow morning?

text: And then pull two coffee cups out of the pile to wash.  She had her coffee the next morning and it was a little bit easier to get up off the floor.
summary: she had her coffee the next morning and it was a little bit easier to wash .

text: When we liberate ourselves from the idea that we are a good person or a bad person with care tasks,  we can stop thinking about the right way to do things, about the way that things should be done,  and instead start thinking about what we can do with our current barriers to improve our quality of life today.
summary: when we liberate ourselves from the idea that we are a good person or a bad person with care tasks, we can stop thinking about the right way to do things . instead start thinking about what we can do with our current barriers to improve our quality of life today .

text: And this is the fun part, because you get to customize a life that works for you.
summary: this is the fun part, because you get to customize a life that works for you.

text: When Lula realized that her problems with brushing her teeth were not moral failings,  she gained the confidence to speak to her dental hygienist,  and together they came up with solutions that work around her barriers.
summary: Lula gained the confidence to speak to her dental hygienist . they came up with solutions that work around her barriers .

text: She now relies on pre-pasted disposable toothbrushes that she keeps in her desk,  floss she keeps in the living room, and a no-rinse prescription toothpaste.
summary: she now relies on pre-pasted disposable toothbrushes that she keeps in her desk . she now uses a no-rinse prescription toothpaste .

text: Because by breaking down the component parts of a dental hygiene routine  and ensuring that each step was accessible to her mental and physical needs,  for the first time in a year she's done every step in that routine for two weeks straight.
summary: for the first time in a year she's done every step in that routine for two weeks straight . every step is accessible to her mental and physical needs .

text: She says that now that her teeth are clean, she's a little less stressed about tomorrow's problems.
summary: she says that now that her teeth are clean, she's a little less stressed about tomorrow's problems.

text: And this approach can work with any care task that you struggle with.
summary: this approach can work with any care task that you struggle with . if you are struggling with care tasks, this approach will work with your care task .

text: Simply ask yourself, what am I trying to achieve and how can I achieve it in my way?
summary: ask yourself, what am I trying to achieve and how can I achieve it in my way?

text: In a rare moment of folding clothes,  I looked down at the baby onesie that I was folding,  and I thought to myself, why am I folding this?
summary: in a rare moment of folding clothes, I looked down at the baby onesie that I was folding . I thought to myself, why am I folding this?

text: Baby onesies don't really wrinkle. And even if they did, nobody cares if a baby's on a wrinkly onesie.
summary: nobody cares if a baby's on a wrinkly onesie .

text: Furthermore, I was probably going to change her four times before lunch.
summary: i was probably going to change her four times before lunch . she was likely going to be changed four times .

summary: this doesn't need to be folded . it's not necessary to fold it .

text: I said it out loud and literally braced myself for the laundry police.
summary: i said it out loud and literally braced myself for the laundry police . it was a joke .

text: There are rules to laundry.

text: But for the first time I stopped thinking about the way that laundry should be done,  and instead started thinking about how I could make laundry functional for me.
summary: for the first time I stopped thinking about the way that laundry should be done . instead started thinking about how I could make laundry functional for me .

text: And I looked down at the fleece pajamas and the underwear and the athletic shorts  and the tank tops and realized almost none of my clothes actually needed to be folded. And I haven't folded any of it since.
summary: fleece pajamas and underwear, athletic shorts and tank tops . I haven't folded any clothes since .

text: I moved all of my family's clothes into one closet off the laundry room  and now I just toss things into organized bins unfolded.
summary: i moved all of my family's clothes into one closet off the laundry room . now I just toss things into organized bins unfolded .

text: My new motto is good enough is perfect.
summary: my new motto is good enough is perfect . i'm not a big fan of the word "good enough"

text: And everything worth doing is worth doing half-assed.
summary: everything worth doing is worth doing half-assed . it's worth doing a half-a-hour .

text: You have to give yourself permission to do a little, to do it with shortcuts,  to do it while breaking all of the rules,  and replace that inner voice that says,  I'm failing with one that says, I'm having a hard time right now.
summary: you have to give yourself permission to do a little, to do it with shortcuts . replace that inner voice that says, I'm having a hard time right now .

text: And people who are having a hard time deserve compassion.
summary: people who are having a hard time deserve compassion . they deserve to be able to help others who are struggling .

text: If it's too hard to shower today, grab the baby wipes.
summary: if it's too hard to shower today, grab the baby wipes . the baby's wipes are a must-have for the shower .

text: It may not be the normal way to do it, but you deserve to be clean.
summary: it may not be the normal way to do it, but you deserve to be clean .

text: If it's too hard to cook dinner, get paper plates.
summary: if it's too hard to cook dinner, get paper plates . if you're too hard, make a paper plate.

summary: heat up something frozen . reheat it to 375°C . heat up a little more water .

text: You'll go back to cooking and washing another day, but the day is not today.
summary: you'll go back to cooking and washing another day, but the day is not today .

text: And in the meantime, you deserve to eat.
summary: in the meantime, you deserve to eat . if you haven't been to the u.s. for a while, you should eat.

text: If you're too depressed to do your dishes, get a two-gallon ziplock bag and keep it in your bedroom.
summary: if you're too depressed to do dishes, get a two-gallon ziplock bag . keep it in your bedroom .

text: Because if you put a dirty plate into a two-gallon ziplock bag and seal it,  it will keep the bugs away.
summary: if you put a dirty plate into a ziplock bag and seal it, it will keep the bugs away .

text: And it will be there for you when you're ready to go back to the kitchen.
summary: it will be there for you when you're ready to go back to the kitchen .

text: Because you deserve a sanitary environment, even if you can't get out of bed.
summary: because you deserve a sanitary environment, even if you can't get out of bed.

text: I could share with you hundreds of other genius solutions that people have come up with  once they embrace the idea that care tasks are morally neutral.
summary: care tasks are morally neutral . i could share with you hundreds of other genius solutions that people have come up with .

text: In my experience, people will exhibit mind-blowing creativity  when they are only taught how to speak compassionately to themselves.
summary: in my experience, people will exhibit mind-blowing creativity when they are only taught how to speak compassionately to themselves.

text: So what if mental health treatment started here?
summary: mental health treatment started here . what if mental health treatments started here? mental health care is a mental health problem .

text: By shifting the idea of care tasks as these external measurements of your worthiness  to just being morally neutral tasks that you can customize to care for yourself.
summary: the idea of care tasks as these external measurements of your worthiness is shifting to just being morally neutral tasks that you can customize to care for yourself.

summary: if it's true that regardless of what you struggle with, you are worthy of a functional space . what else might you be worthy of?
